chapter.title: DHIS 2 Spreadsheet Reporting
chapter.para: The information in the system is available in many different formats, such as: .xls, .doc, .pdf, .csv., etc. which are familiar to different end-users. In this sense, a sustainable information system with an extended support for .xls (tables, sheets, and expressions) is a prerequisite while in the developing countries like Vietnam, India, Sri Lanka, etc use spreadsheet application (from Microsoft Office and Open Office) for their routine documents and reports. At the same time, this also supports efficiently for implementation processes by reducing time and effort for training and maintenance because of its friendliness and powerfulness of availability and flexibility.

The end-users, especially health workers with an average knowledge of computing, can use DHIS 2 easily with the new spreadsheet reporting tool (or probably called as Spreadsheet reporting) developed by the Vietnam developer team. This module has been based on HISP India team’s ideas and technologies. The module has subsequently been merged into the main DHIS2 application under the Vietnam (vn) local branch for available usage. There will be a session for instructing "how to include the Spreadsheet reporting module into DHIS2". This reporting tool with spreadsheet output files uses less memory and it is comparatively faster when compared to other reporting platforms. The spreadsheet reporting module provides a flexible reporting framework, which should be immediately intuitively useful for many users who are familiar with this.

para.emphasis: Figure 1: Administration sections

section.title: Include 'Spreadsheet reports' module into DHIS2
section.para: The following is the steps of building/developing an DHIS2 package with spreadsheet report module.

para.emphasis: Step 1: Download DHIS2 source-code and some other necessary tools

section.para: See the instructions from here: http://dhis2.org/development#quickstart
esp. the first 3 points.

para.emphasis: Step 2: Build the source-code at first without the Spreadsheet module

section.para: See the instructions from here: http://dhis2.org/development#quickstart
esp. the fourth point with 2 build commands with maven.

para.emphasis: Step 3: Build the Spreadsheet module and then rebuild the DHIS2 package including it

section.para: Go to the spreadsheet module and execute the building commands: mvn clean install -Dmaven.test.skip=true
Normally, the spreadsheet module is located at: <dhis2_source_folder>\dhis2\local\vn:
3.1: Run the mvn command under "dhis-service-excel-reporting" folder.

para.emphasis: for example:

section.para: 3.1: Run the mvn command under "dhis-web-excel-reporting" folder.
3.2: Edit the pom.xml file under "dhis-web-portal" (at: <dhis2_source_folder>\dhis2\dhis-2\dhis-web\dhis-web-portal) to include the Spreadsheet module
for example:
3.3: Build the web-portal module:
(at: <dhis2_source_folder>\dhis2\dhis-2\dhis-web\dhis-web-portal)
for example:
After successfully build the package, the dhis.war in the target folder of dhis-web-portal module will be produced.
Copy this war file to the webapps folder of your tomcat folder.
In order to make a fresh update for your new dhis2, before starting tomcat, delete the old dhis.war file and "dhis" folder under webapps.

para.emphasis: Step 4: Run the DHIS2 built package with Spreadsheet module

section.para: Run tomcat (execute the bath file under <tomcat_folder>\bin\startup.bat (for Windows) or ...\startup.sh (for Linux).
Then wait until the start-up finishes and open a web browser (Firefox recommended) to run the DHIS2 application with the local url or your IP address:
So good-luck to you for further exploration/hacking with dhis2.
For further support, please send an email to the developer mailing list:
"DHIS 2 developers" <dhis2-devs@lists.launchpad.net>

section.title: Administration
section.para: There are 6 sections for the "Administration" of this reporting tool.

listitem.para: Configuration: Set a path to the directory where the spreadsheet template files are stored. This file path should be a relative directory on your system. For instance, if the home directory of DHIS 2 (by setting the absolute path with the DHIS2_HOME environmental variable) is "C:\dhis2" and you want to name the template folder "templates", just set: "templates" for Windows or "templates" for Linux, then the absolute path of your template folder will be: "C:\dhis2\spreadsheet_template\templates" (Windows).

para.emphasis: Figure 2: Configuration setting

listitem.para: Export reports: This module allows users to assign reports to different organizational units . There are four types of reports that are currently supported: a report containing standard data elements, a report listing organisation unit groups as rows, a report listing period of time as columns, a report generating data elements combined with categories.

para.emphasis: Figure 3: Export report list

listitem.para: Report associations are used to determine which organizational units the report should be associated with. Click the "Report Associations" button, and assign all the organizational units which this report applies to by either clicking on the organizational units listed in the hierarchy tree, or by selecting the appropriate organizational unit group through the drop down menu.

Data Entry Status (or view the status of the data entry): View the data entry status to know about data entered, reports finished or not finished yet with data entry. In order to view the data entry status, adding data sets which is equivalent to the data entry is mandatory.

Import Reports items: In many situations, health workers in the field may not have good Internet access, and will therefore need to enter data offline and to transmit this data via email or other means, for subsequent importation into the DHIS database. The spreadsheet Report data import feature allows users to import data from a pre-designed spreadsheet templates directly into the DHIS database automatically. Users enter data into a predefined spreadsheet template, send via email or other means for importation into DHIS2. It is also possible to import selected elements. This module supports three types of reports namely a report containing standard data elements, a report listing organisation unit groups as rows, a report generating data elements combined with categories.
Excel /Spreadsheet Template Management: Manage the Template spreadsheet files which are used to export reports, includes upload, download, delete and rename files.

Clean temporary directory: Every time a user generates a report, the system creates an spreadsheet file in the temporary directory (spreadsheetreporttemplate directory). This disk space occupied by this directory will become progressively larger after some time. This function will remove all the temporary files from the directory, and therefore decrease the total amount of disk space used.

section.title: Configuration
section.para: The directory configuration is to set the path of the directory containing the spreadsheet Template (.xls) file.
In order to set the directory, choose Administrator > Configuration> Set path and specify the path. The procedure is outlined in more detail below.

listitem.para: Click Administration to open Administrator page.

para.emphasis: Figure 4: Configuration menu

listitem.para: Click Configuration button
Set a relative path to the folder containing spreadsheet file
An spreadsheet template directory is simply a directory that will be used to contain all the necessary files. It is automatically created the folder under DHIS2_HOME folder.

para.emphasis: Figure 5: Configure the directory relative path for spreadsheet templates

listitem.para: Click OK to save

section.title: Export Reports
section.para: The function allows users to create reports and its items and to assign the organisation units or the organisation unit groups to the reports. Each of the functions of this module will be described below.

section.title: Types of report
section.para: Before generating reports, there is a need to create spreadsheet report template files. Reports will be generated in a standard format according to the structure defined in the template. Currently, there are four report types that the module can support.

para.emphasis: Standard reports contain default data elements and indicators

listitem.para: Standard reports have a fixed model in which number of the columns and the rows are unchangeable. Normally, this report is generated by only one organisation unit or one organisation unit group at a specified period of time. An example is show below.

para.emphasis: Figure 6: A spreadsheet template with standard reports
Row-based reports with multiple organisational

listitem.para: This type of report displays data elements’ name in the fixed columns, and organisation units are be displayed automatically according to the selected parents organisation unit in a period of time. These organisation units are also grouped together following the administrative level, such as: province, district, commune, etc.

para.emphasis: Figure 7: A spreadsheet template with row-based reports
Reports list time periods in the columns

listitem.para: This report display data values according to the fixed data element names, and the list of time periods are displayed automatically.

para.emphasis: Figure 8: A spreadsheet template with period-listing reports
Reports with data elements and categories

listitem.para: This type of report displays data values which are combined of data elements and category combination. Data element names display as rows and category options are displayed as columns. Data elements’ names, codes may be displayed automatically as well as the sequence numbers of the rows

para.emphasis: Figure 9: A spreadsheet template with data-element and categories reports

section.title: Create a new report in DHIS2 with spreadsheet report template file
section.para: When the spreadsheet report template file is available, creating a new report and the relevant report items are required. A step-by-step procedure is provided below.

listitem.para: To create a new report, choose Administration --> Export Reports --> Add --> Fill the information form --> OK
To create report items in the report choose Administration --> Export Reports --> Choose a report --> Report Items --> Add --> Fill information form --> OK

section.title: Create new report
section.para: Click Export Reports

para.emphasis: Figure 10: Administration - Export Reports menu

section.para: Add new report: Click Add button to add new report

para.emphasis: Figure 11: The list of export reports

section.para: Each of the fields should be filled in.

listitem.para: Name *: Enter a descriptive name of the report.
spreadsheet Template*: Choose a spreadsheet report template file from the list.

para.emphasis: Figure 12: Choose a template for an export report

listitem.para: The template files can be updated by uploading the spreadsheet files under "spreadsheet Template Management" session.

para.emphasis: Report Type *: Choose report type

listitem.para: Normal : to create reports include just data elements or indicators
Category : to create reports with data values are combined of data elements and categories
Period column listing: to create reports which list data values according to time period of specified organisation unit.
Organisation unit listing: reports which list data values according to organisation units.
Period position row and Period position column: Row and Column Number in spreadsheet template file where to put Period value.
Organisation Unit Row and Organisation Unit Column: Row and Column Number in spreadsheet template file where to put Organisation Unit Name.
Click OK button to create new report

para.emphasis: Figure 13: Overview of functions for an export report

section.para: There are buttons that can be used for various actions as depicted below:

para.emphasis: Figure 14: Functions with detailed descriptions.

listitem.para: Organisation level for setting organisation group level.
Report Associations for assigning reports to organisation units
Simply select the organizational units that this report will be generated for.

The Report Item function is used to define which values will appear in the desired report. Report items consist of specific values of data which will be placed into particular cells of the spreadsheet when the report is generated.Further information for configuration of the report items will be provided in the next section.
The Remove deletes the spreadsheet report.
Edit for editing report’s information.
Organisation unit Group for choose which organisation group would be list in the report. This button only appears when the Report Type is Organisation Unit Listing
Data element groups for creating Data element group and these groups of data elements would be list in the report. This button is only available when the report type is a "Category" report.
Period column for creating Period column. THis button is only available when the report type is a "Reports list time periods in the columns"

section.title: Create report items
section.para: Click Create Report Item button to begin the process of defining a new report. Report items consist of different types of data that will be dynamically generated based on a user's inputs during the report generation phase. Report items must be defined and referenced to a particular spreadsheet template.

para.emphasis: Figure 15: Export Item List menu

section.para: Click on the list of "Export Item" (screen-shot above)

para.emphasis: Figure 16: Overview the operations toward an export-items

section.para: Add button to open a form
Fill the report item’s information. Each of the fields is described below in more detail.

para.emphasis: Figure 17: Instructions for creating an item

listitem.para: Name: Enter a descriptive name for the report. (Ex: Total person joined HIA)
Item Type:
Data element : Select this item type if the value of a particular data element should be placed in the spreadsheet report.
Indicator: Select this item type if the value of a particular indicator should be placed in the spreadsheet report.
Spreadsheet formula: Select this item type if an spreadsheet formula should be placed in the cell. You will need to define the spreadsheet formula in the next step.
Serial : A sequential number will automatically be generated and placed in the report.
Organisation: if report item is list of organisation unit.

Period Type*: Chose period type which data values of that report item would be aggregated and displays according to period parameter that user will choose when generate report. (Last 3 months, Last 6 months, So far this year, Quarterly, Six-Monthly, Yearly).

Expression *: Click Expression button to define a particular data element or combination of data elements in a formula, if you have selected this report item type. If this report item type is "Organization" or "Serial" this option is not relevant. If the report item type is an spreadsheet formula, it should be entered directly in the text box. For instance, a valid spreadsheet formula might be "=C1R1/C2R1", which would divide the cell in position (1,1) in the spreadsheet by the cell in position (2,1)

para.emphasis: Figure 18: Instructions for defining an expression for an item

listitem.para: The category option would be default if data element hasn’t been combined with any category combo. Other options are described below:
Sheet No*: Specify the sheet number where this report item would be display in the spreadsheet template file.
Row*: Row number refers to cell where report item would be display in spreadsheet file.
Column*: Column number refers to cell where report item would be display in spreadsheet file.
Once all items have been filled in, click the "OK" button to save the report definition.

para.emphasis: Figure 19: Confirm and Save the item's modification

section.para: You will be informed that a new report item has been created.

The "Copy to Export" function can be used to copy spreadsheet report items from one report to another. Therefore, there is no need to redefine an spreadsheet report item, if it will appear in two different reports. You can simply copy the item from one report definition to the other by following this procedure.
From list of reports page, click "Add new report."
From the source report, select the report items that should be copied by clicking on the appropriate check boxes of the items.
Click the "Copy report items to Export" button.
Export report: Chose the destination report.
Sheet No: Choose the sheet number where the report items would be displayed.
Finally, Click the OK button to copy the report items.

para.emphasis: Figure 20: Choose a report and sheet number for copying the items to

section.para: Copy to export items to Import button: To copy the report items from the export reports to an import report.

listitem.para: From source report, select report items need to be copied.
Click the Copy export items to Import button
Import Reports: chose a destination report
Sheet No: Choose the Sheet No at which the import item would be copied to (equilavent to the sheet of the expected importing spreadsheet file).
Click OK button to copy

para.emphasis: Figure 21: Choose an import report and sheet number for copying the items to

section.title: Assign a report to Org Units
section.para: This function will determine which organizational units the report should be assigned to. Click theReport Associations button from the main page.

para.emphasis: Figure 22: Report Assignment for OrganizationUnits

section.para: Chose OrgUnits to assign and click the Save button.
Figure 23: Report Assignment for OrganizationUnits (cont.)
Select each organizational unit that the report can be generated for, or alternatively, select multiple organizational units by selecting a particular organizational unit level or group.
This function only appears in Organization Unit Listing report type.
Click Organisation Unit group button.

para.emphasis: Figure 24: OrganizationUnit Group setting for an export report

section.para: Select Organisation unit groups, arrange sequence of these groups, and click OK to save.

para.emphasis: Figure 25: In details for OrganizationUnit Group setting

section.title: Assign report to user role
section.para: To manage the authority of using the reports, we should assign reports to user roles. This allows the administrator to decide which users are able to view certain reports.

listitem.para: From Export Reports sub-menu (see Fig. 22), choose Assign user-role for the export report

para.emphasis: Figure 26: User Role menu

listitem.para: Then setting the User Roles for the export report

para.emphasis: Figure 27: User role
setting for the report

emphasis.emphasis: How to define an user-role, see the following screenshots:

listitem.para: Go to User Role management:
Maintenance >> Users >> User Role

para.emphasis: Figure 28: User Role menu

listitem.para: Then choose an user role to edit or create a new user role:

para.emphasis: Figure 29: User Role management

listitem.para: Setting for an user role:

para.emphasis: Figure 30: User Role settings for dataset and functions access

section.title: Data Entry Status
section.para: This function allows users to see which datasets are entered with data and how the data values are entered. This helps save time for the health manager to follow the completeness of the data entered. In particular, there is a need of viewing data set entry status.
Add data set to view

para.emphasis: Figure 31: Data-Entry Status Management menu

section.para: Data Entry Status page would be displayed. Click Add button to add data set.

para.emphasis: Figure 32: Add a new status management

section.para: Then select the desired data set and Organisation Unit from the menu.

para.emphasis: Figure 33: Choose an Organization Unit for data-entry status

section.para: And set-up for the data-entry status by choosing the dataset:

para.emphasis: Figure 34: Choose an dataset for data-entry status

section.para: Moreover, you can choose/pick the statuses as the defaults for the organization unit:

para.emphasis: Figure 35a: Set-up default for the status
Figure 35b: The list of data-entry status

section.para: An screen-shot example:
Figure 35c: Data-entry status of an organization unit by its datasets

section.title: Spreadsheet/Import items
section.para: The function allows users to import data from a pre-designed spreadsheet templates directly into the DHIS database automatically. Alternatively, selected elements may be imported. This is a particularly useful feature for importing data from other users that may not have DHIS2 installed on their computers. For instance, it may be more feasible to have users at a primary care health facility enter their values in spreadsheet directly. Users may be immediately familiar with spreadsheet, and can easily enter data into a pre-defined template. Installation of DHIS2 on their computers may complicate a particular implementation, and require additional resources in terms of training. By using pre-defined templates for importation into the DHIS2 database, users that do not have DHIS2 can easily transmit data to users that do, for instance from the primary health care facility to the district level.

para.emphasis: Figure 33: Import Report List

section.title: Create a template to import
section.para:
To create a group, choose Administration -> Import Reports -> Add --> Fill the information form and press OK.
To create items in the grorp, choose Administration --> Import Reports --> Choose a group --> Spreadsheet/Excel items --> Fill information form -> OK.
Creating a spreadsheet items group which contains spreadsheet items. A spreadsheet item correspond with a data cell into inputted template spreadsheet files. A step-by-step procedure is provided below.

para.emphasis: Figure 32: Create a new Import Item

listitem.para: Name *: Enter Name of report.

Report Type *: Choose report type
Normal : to create group include just data elements or indicator
Category : to create group with data values are combined of data elements and categories
Organisation unit listing : groups which list data values according to organisation units.
Period Type *: Type of period to import data values.

section.para: Click OK button to create new report.
There are buttons that can be used for various actions as depicted below.

para.emphasis: Figure 33: Operations of import reports

listitem.para: Associations for assigning a group to organisation units.
Spreadsheet item group for creating report items in the report.
Remove for removing spreadsheet item group.
Edit for editing information of group.
Organisation unit Group for choose which organisation group would be list in the group. This button only appear when the Group Type is Organisation Unit Listing
Data element groups for create Data element group and these groups of data elements would be list in the report. This button only available when report type is Category.

section.title: Create spreadsheet items
section.para: Click Add button to open a form.

para.emphasis: Figure 34: Import item description

section.para:
Fill information of an spreadsheet items.
Name*: Enter item name
Expression *: Click Expression button to choose Data element, Indicator, Or just type spreadsheet formula if Item type is spreadsheet formula.
Figure 35: Expression building
The category option would be default if data element hasn’t been combined with any category combo. Other options are described below:
Sheet No*: type sheet no where this item would be display in spreadsheet template file
Row*: row number refers to cell where item would be display in spreadsheet file.
Column*: column number refers to cell where item would be display in spreadsheet file.
Click OK button to create item.
Copy selected items to button: To copy the report items when the new report has an item which can be reused from the existing report

para.emphasis: Figure 36: Choose import report and sheet number

listitem.para: From List of groups page, select items need to be copied.
Click the Copy selected items to button.
List of groups: chose a destination report.
Sheet No: Choose the Sheet No which report Item would be display.
Click OK button to copy.

section.title: Spreadsheet Template Management
section.para: This is used to manage Template spreadsheet files which are used to export reports, includes upload, download, delete and rename files.

para.emphasis: Figure 37: Excel Template Management

section.para: To upload template file, choose Browse button.

para.emphasis: Figure 38: Upload a template

section.para: Choose a file from shown dialog

para.emphasis: Figure 39: Choose a spreadsheet file

section.para: Click Open to choose file, and click Upload button to upload. If successfully, the uploaded file will be shown in the list:
No upload if the chosen file is not spreadsheet file.
This allows the user to clean temporary directory.

listitem.para: From Main menu, choose Maintenance > Clean temporary directory

para.emphasis: Figure 40: Clean-up temporary files

section.title: Spreadsheet Reports
section.para: There are 3 functions of the module.

listitem.para: Generate Report: Allow users to generate reports according to parameters such as time period, organisation unit, organisation unit group and to generate group of reports to many sheets of a single spreadsheet file.
Import spreadsheet files: Imports data values from an spreadsheet file to the DHIS2 system.
Data entry Status: View data entry status.

section.title: Generate report
section.para: To generate a report just follow the simple steps outlined below.

listitem.para: Click "Generate Report".
Select an Organisational Unit on the left.
Select a Report Group.
Select a Report from the Report list.
Select a period of time from the Period drop-down.
Click Generate Report button to generate the report.

section.para: With "Preview Report" function, you can preview the report with DHIS2 before download the equivalent spreadsheet report.
With "Print Preview" (or maybe labelled as "Print Draft"), you can download/print out the current preview report directly without generating a spreadsheet file and this will reduce time-consuming.

section.title: Data entry status report
section.para: This function allows users to see which datasets are entered with data and what percentage of data has been entered for different datasets, organizational units and time periods. This allows the person responsible for monitoring data completeness (e.g. district health manager) to monitor the level of data completness easily.
View Data entry status
From Left menu, click Data Entry Status > Select Org Unit name to view.
The Data entry status is displayed as percentage. The relative percentage of data elements that were entered in the form.
